1901880.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901880.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901880
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 001
1901880.text: Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari said: "We were in the home of the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) one day, and he served a meal. I had never seen a meal from which greater blessing was obtained at the beginning of our eating, nor less blessing at the end of it, so we said: 'O Messenger of Allah, how is this?' He said: 'We mentioned the Name of Allah when we ate. Then someone who ate sat down and did not pronounce the Name of Allah (Exalted is He), so Satan ate with him!’”

1901890.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901890.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901890
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 002
1901890.text: 'A’isha said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘If one of you eats and forgets to mention Allah (Exalted is He) during his meal, let him say: B'ismillah awwalahu wa akhirahu, which means, 'In the name of Allah at its beginning and at its end'.”

1901900.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901900.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901900
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 003
1901900.text: 'Umar ibn Abi Salama said that he went in to see Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), who had a meal before him, so he said to him: 'O my dear son, pronounce the Name of Allah(Exalted is He), eat with your right hand, and eat what is directly in front of you!’”

1901910.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901910.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901910
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 004
1901910.text: Abu Sa‘id al-Khudri said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to say, when he had finished his meal: ‘Praise be to Allah, who has fed us and quenched our thirst, and has made us Muslims'!”

1901920.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901920.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901920
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 005
1901920.text: Abu Umama said: “When the table was removed from in front of him, Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to say: ‘Much fine blessed praise to Allah! It is neither the last of our food, nor can it be dispensed with, O our Lord'!”

1901930.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901930.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901930
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 006
1901930.text: 'Aisha said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) was eating with six of his Companions, when a Bedouin came and devoured it in two mouthfuls, so Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'If he had invoked the Name of Allah, it would have been enough for you all'!”

1901940.book: The Words That Of Rasoolullah Said Before and After Eating
1901940.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901940
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 27, Hadith 007
1901940.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'Allah is surely well pleased with the servant’s eating and praising Him for the food, or drinking and praising Him for the drink'!”
